title: Drawing, "Design for a Painted Porcelain:   "Cabbage Leaf" Salad Bowl, for Sèvres Porcelain Manufactory", 1760–75
medium: Brush and watercolor, black chalk on cream laid paper
markings: Watermark: D C BLAUW, similar to Churchill 328; stamped in black, upper right center: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration; lower right corner, verso: Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, upper center:  N° 8  hauteur d'une Saladier feuilles de choux p're grandeur; along lower right edge, sideways:  N° 8  hauteur d'une Saladier feuilles de choux p're grandeur. 60.; in graphite, lower left corner, verso (up-side-down):  p. 16
provenance: From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli. From the Collection of Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: View of salad bowl in elevation (above) and plan (below), painted on exterior and interior in form of large cabbage-like leaves, each leaf of which is bordered alternatively in blue and yellow/brown painted scallops.  The reserves are painted with sprays of roses, tulips, colored daisies.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Painted Porcelain:   "Cabbage Leaf" Salad Bowl, for Sèvres Porcelain Manufactory", 1760–75.
1760–75. Brush and watercolor, black chalk on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-8312.
